Hoyle points out, the Big Bang theory requires the creation of the universe
from nothing. This is because, as you go back in time, you reach a point in
time at which, in Hoyle’s words, the universe was “shrunk down to nothing
at all.“**Thus, what the Big Bang model requires is that the universe began to
exist and was created out of nothing.
